components.content:
If you already receive enough financial support from your bank or credit card company you should not apply for this loan.

If you still think you're eligible to apply you should contact the Foreign and Commonwealth Office using the emergency loan enquiry form.

If you're in need of urgent assistance, contact your nearest embassy. Find your nearest embassy here.

components.content:
In these circumstances we cannot guarantee to be able to process your application for a subsistence loan.

However, if you would like to proceed with an application for a subsistence loan please email emergency.subsistenceloans@fco.gov.uk stating your full name as on your passport and the country you are currently in.

components.content:
You can take a photo of your passport on your phone and upload it immediately. If you’re on a computer you can take a photo and email it to yourself.

You can finish your online application without uploading a photo of your passport, but you need to provide one before your loan can be paid.

If you’re unable to upload a photo of your passport now the Foreign and Commonwealth Office will contact you to discuss alternative ways of proving your identity.

components.name: canUploadPhotoNow
components.title: Are you able to upload a picture of your passport now?

pages.title: Upload a photo of your passport
Upload a photo of your passport

components.content:
Add a photo of the main page of your UK passport – the page with the passport photo. Make sure all four corners of your passport are visible.

If you have a newly issued UK passport, your photo needs to include both the page with your passport photo and the page with your signature.

components.title: How to photograph your passport
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the passport.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

pages.title: Check your answers before submitting your application
Coronavirus (COVID-19): get financial support to help you return to the UK

components.content:
You can apply for an emergency interest-free loan if you’re a British national who has been unable to return to the UK due coronavirus (COVID-19) restrictions.

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) will assess each application before approving any loan.

If your application is approved, the FCO will use the loan to book you a return flight home to the UK. If there are currently no flights from the country you’re in, you can use the loan to help with emergency living costs until a flight becomes available.

If it is possible for you to fly back to the UK and you choose not to, you will not be eligible for an emergency loan.

All loans must be repaid in full. You cannot apply if you live abroad permanently or if you want to extend your stay in another country.

If you are in danger or have been a victim of crime, contact your nearest embassy.

Before you apply

You need to make sure you have no other means of financial support, for example from your insurance provider, tour operator, bank or family and friends. The FCO will not offer you an emergency loan if you can get financial support elsewhere.

Check the Travel Advice page to see if there are currently flights to the UK from the country you are in.

Who can apply for a loan

! Warning Every British national aged 18 years old or older must apply for their own loan. If you have children under the age of 18, only one parent needs to apply for the children.

You can apply if you:

  • are a British national or dual British national
  • are 18 years old or older
  • live in the UK
  • have a UK bank account
  • have tried to get financial help from elsewhere but have no other option

If you’re a British national who needs support but does not live in the UK, you can fill in an emergency loan enquiry form.

What you’ll need to apply

You’ll need:

  • a photo of proof of your UK home address, such as driving licence, utility bill, tenancy agreement or recent credit card or bank statement
  • your UK bank account details
  • a photo of the main page of your UK passport

You can still apply if you cannot upload a photo of your passport or proof of address, but it might take longer. The FCO will contact you after you apply to discuss another way of providing those details.

Repaying the loan

You’ll need to repay your loan or set up a repayment plan within 6 months of getting the loan. If you do not, your passport may be cancelled and your details may be passed to a debt collection agency.

Find out how FCO will process your data if you apply for an emergency loan for living costs while you’re abroad.

Other ways to apply

If you are unable to apply online, you can fill in an emergency loan enquiry form.

After you apply

The FCO will contact you within 3 working days with an update.

components.content: You can take a photo of your proof of address on your phone and upload it immediately. If you’re on a computer you can take a photo and email it to yourself.

components.title: What counts as a proof of address?
components.content:
• driving licence
  • utility bill
  • recent credit card or bank statement
  • tenancy agreement

You can finish your online application without uploading a photo of your proof of address, but you need to provide one before your loan can be paid.

If you’re unable to upload a photo of your proof of address now the Foreign and Commonwealth Office will contact you to discuss alternative ways of proving your identity.

Upload a proof of address

components.content: Add a photo of a proof of your UK address, such as a driving licence, utility bill, tenancy agreement or recent credit card or bank statement

components.title: How to photograph your proof of address
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the proof of address.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

pages.title: Do you live in the UK?

components.content:
Before you apply for an emergency loan from the Foreign and Commonwealth Office, you need to make sure that you cannot get financial support elsewhere.

You should contact everyone who might be able to help, such as your insurance provider, tour operator, bank or family and friends.

Only apply for this loan if you have explored all other options and still have no means of financial support.

components.name: haveExhaustedAllOptions
components.title: Have you explored all other options for financial support?

pages.title: Try and get financial support elsewhere

components.content:
Based on your answers you may be eligible for an interest-free emergency loan to help cover living costs until a return flight to the UK becomes available.

Keep checking the Travel Advice page for the latest news about return flights to the UK from the country you're in.

The loan is only for people who are unable to return to the UK due to coronavirus restrictions. If it’s possible for you to return to the UK but you choose not to, you will not be eligible for the loan.

You’ll need to repay your loan or set up a repayment plan within 6 months of getting the loan. If you do not, your passport may be cancelled and your details may be passed to a debt collection agency.

components.content:
Based on your answers you may be eligible for an emergency interest-free loan to cover the costs of a return flight to the UK. The Foreign and Commonwealth Office will use the loan amount to book your return flight as one becomes available.

You’ll need to repay your loan or set up a repayment plan within 6 months of getting the loan. If you do not, your passport may be cancelled and your details may be passed to a debt collection agency.

pages.title: You need to live in the UK to use this service

components.content:
You are only eligible for financial assistance from the Foreign and Commonwealth Office if you have no other means of support.

You must make sure that you can’t get financial assistance elsewhere. Before you apply you should contact anyone who might be able to help, including your:

  • tour operator
  • travel insurance company
  • bank or credit card company
  • friends and family
components.name: /check-financial-assistance-827-827

pages.title: You need to check if you're able to get financial assistance from somewhere else

components.content:
If there are return flights available but you choose not to return to the UK, you will not be eligible for an emergency loan to cover living costs.

If you need to tell us anything about your current circumstances you should contact the Foreign and Commonwealth Office using the emergency loan enquiry form.

If you're in need of urgent assistance, contact your nearest embassy. Find your nearest embassy here.

If you're in need of urgent assistance, contact your nearest embassy. Find your nearest embassy here.

components.name: emergencyLoanLoanAmount
components.title: How much do you need to borrow?
components.hint:
The emergency loan can cover up to 3 months of essential living costs.

If you apply for an amount higher than £3000, it may take longer to process.

The loan must be repaid.

declaration:
You must declare:

  • you are a British citizen
  • that you usually reside in the UK
  • that you are currently in the country you selected in this application
  • that you understand this is a loan and not a gift - you have to repay this money
  • that you understand providing false or deliberately misleading information may make you ineligible for UK government assistance.
